title: Add naming conversion utilities to ast_utils.py
description:
Add utilities for converting between naming conventions to eliminate duplication across move_field.py, extract_class.py, and inline_class.py.

Functions to add:
1. camel_to_snake_case(name: str) -> str - Convert CamelCase/PascalCase to snake_case
2. generate_field_name_from_class(class_name: str, prefix: str = "", strip_suffixes: list[str] | None = None) -> str

Acceptance criteria:
- Both functions with proper type hints
- camel_to_snake_case handles edge cases correctly
- generate_field_name_from_class produces readable field names
- Unit tests covering various naming patterns

title: Refactor commands to use new shared utilities
description:
Refactor all command classes to use the newly created shared utilities, eliminating duplicated code and improving maintainability.

Commands to refactor:
- extract_method.py, extract_function.py: Use parse_target_with_range/line
- collapse_hierarchy.py, push_down_field.py, move_field.py: Use pass statement utilities
- push_down_field.py, extract_subclass.py, move_field.py, hide_delegate.py: Use attribute checking
- extract_interface.py, extract_superclass.py: Use module insertion utilities
- move_field.py, extract_class.py, inline_class.py: Use naming utilities
- extract_superclass.py, extract_subclass.py, push_down_field.py, move_field.py, inline_class.py: Use code generation utilities
- move_field.py, extract_class.py, inline_class.py, move_method.py: Use transformers
- extract_subclass.py: Use SelfFieldChecker visitor

Also refactor commands that manually split on "::" to use parse_target()

Acceptance criteria:
- All listed commands refactored to use shared utilities
- Remove duplicate method implementations from commands
- All existing tests still pass
- No behavioral changes to commands
- Estimated 300-400 lines of code removed

Add pass statement detection utilities to ast_utils.py
description:
Add utilities for detecting pass statements and empty classes to eliminate duplication across collapse_hierarchy.py, push_down_field.py, and move_field.py.

Functions to add:
1. is_pass_statement(stmt: cst.BaseStatement) -> bool
2. is_empty_class(class_def: cst.ClassDef) -> bool  
3. statements_contain_only_pass(stmts: list[cst.BaseStatement]) -> bool

Acceptance criteria:
- All 3 functions added with proper type hints
- Handle edge cases (empty lists, None, etc.)
- Unit tests covering various scenarios
- Commands can be refactored to use these utilities

title: Add attribute checking utilities to ast_utils.py
description:
Add utilities for checking self.field attribute patterns to eliminate duplication across push_down_field.py, extract_subclass.py, move_field.py, and hide_delegate.py.

Functions to add:
1. is_self_attribute(node: cst.BaseExpression, attr_name: str | None = None) -> bool
2. is_self_field_assignment(stmt: cst.SimpleStatementLine, field_names: set[str] | None = None) -> bool

Acceptance criteria:
- Both functions with proper type hints and optional parameter handling
- Unit tests covering various attribute access patterns
- Commands can be refactored to use these utilities

title: Create code_generation_utils.py module with CST construction utilities
description:
Create new molting/core/code_generation_utils.py module with utilities for constructing common CST nodes to eliminate duplication across multiple command classes.

Functions to add:
1. create_super_init_call(args: list[cst.Arg] | None = None) -> cst.SimpleStatementLine
2. create_field_assignment(field_name: str, value: cst.BaseExpression | None = None) -> cst.SimpleStatementLine
3. create_init_method(params: list[str], field_assignments: dict[str, cst.BaseExpression] | None = None, super_call_args: list[cst.Arg] | None = None) -> cst.FunctionDef
4. create_parameter(name: str, annotation: cst.Annotation | None = None, default: cst.BaseExpression | None = None) -> cst.Param

Acceptance criteria:
- New module created at molting/core/code_generation_utils.py
- All 4 functions with proper type hints
- Functions produce valid, properly formatted CST nodes
- Unit tests verify generated nodes render to valid Python

title: Create transformers.py module with reusable CSTTransformer classes
description:
Create new molting/core/transformers.py module with generic CSTTransformer classes to eliminate duplication of field reference transformers across multiple commands.

Classes to add:
1. SelfFieldRenameTransformer(cst.CSTTransformer) - Generic transformer for renaming self.field references with field_mapping dict, field_prefix, and field_names filtering
2. FieldAccessCollector(cst.CSTVisitor) - Visitor that collects all self.field accesses

Acceptance criteria:
- New module created at molting/core/transformers.py
- Both classes implemented with comprehensive transformation modes
- Unit tests showing various transformation scenarios
- Documentation/examples for common use cases

title: Extend visitors.py with SelfFieldChecker visitor class
description:
Add SelfFieldChecker visitor class to molting/core/visitors.py to provide a boolean checking version of SelfFieldCollector, eliminating duplication in extract_subclass.py.

Class to add:
- SelfFieldChecker(cst.CSTVisitor) - Checks if node accesses any specified self fields, with found: bool flag

Acceptance criteria:
- SelfFieldChecker class added with proper type hints and documentation
- Can short-circuit traversal after first match
- Unit tests showing usage
- extract_subclass.py FeatureChecker classes can be replaced

title: Add module insertion utilities to ast_utils.py
description:
Add utilities for inserting classes at appropriate positions in modules to eliminate duplication between extract_interface.py and extract_superclass.py.

Functions to add:
1. insert_class_after_imports(module: cst.Module, class_def: cst.ClassDef, blank_lines_before: int = 2, blank_lines_after: int = 1) -> cst.Module
2. find_insert_position_after_imports(module: cst.Module) -> int

Acceptance criteria:
- Both functions with proper type hints
- Handle edge cases (no imports, only imports, etc.)
- Preserve module formatting appropriately
- Unit tests covering various module structures

title: Add line number parsing utilities to ast_utils.py
description:
Add utilities for parsing line numbers and line ranges from target specifications to eliminate duplication between ExtractMethodCommand and ExtractFunctionCommand.

Functions to add:
1. parse_line_number(line_spec: str) -> int - Parse "L4" format
2. parse_line_range(line_range: str) -> tuple[int, int] - Parse "L9-L11" format  
3. parse_target_with_line(target: str) -> tuple[str, str, str] - Parse "ClassName::method#L4"
4. parse_target_with_range(target: str) -> tuple[str, str, int, int] - Parse "ClassName::method#L9-L11"

Constants to add:
- TARGET_SEPARATOR = "#"
- LINE_PREFIX = "L"
- LINE_RANGE_SEPARATOR = "-"

Acceptance criteria:
- All 4 functions added with proper type hints and error handling
- Unit tests covering valid and invalid inputs
- ExtractMethodCommand and ExtractFunctionCommand can use these utilities
